so this is what I think Krishnamurthy is
referring to and although as I said he
doesn't like to talk about means in many
traditions means are offered as helps as
I said they cannot produce the real
experience but if we do it in an
intelligent way they can clear out the
obstacles so that the real perception
appears even Krishnamurti said if you
have a room and it's cluttered and you
you cannot even open the window then the
breeze is not going to come in so the
first thing you have to do is to put in
order your room so that you can open
your window now the act of opening the
window will not produce the breeze the
breeze may come or may not but you need
to open the window if the breeze is
going to come on its own so I think all
these different techniques are they
putting in order of the room and if we
do it in the right way and we can open
the window one day the breeze may come
in so this is more or less what I wanted
to share about the concept of cycles as
applied to our daily life and our
spiritual practice we are going to see
in the next session that these cycles
are actually since they are in an
intrinsic part of nature they are
imposed if we want to see it in the way
on us we cannot choose whether to enter
into a cycle or not
Blavatsky calls them the cycles of
necessity but as we were seen we can
learn how to retreat to what we really
are so that we can witness the
inevitable cycles learn from them
whatever is necessary
and still be free from the influence of
these cycles
